item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Sex without love is as hollow and ridiculous as love without sex." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "The fact is always obvious much too late, but the most singular difference between happiness and joy is that happiness is a solid and joy a liquid." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "when you're not looking, somebody'll sneak up and write "Fuck you" right under your nose." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "If you knew what was going to happen, if you knew everything that was going to happen next—if you knew in advance the consequences of your own actions—you'd be doomed. You'd be ruined as God. You'd be a stone. You'd never eat or drink or laugh or get out of bed in the morning. You'd never love anyone, ever again. You'd never dare to." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Romance takes place in the middle distance. Romance is looking in at yourself through a window clouded with dew. Romance means leaving things out: where life grunts and shuffles, romance only sighs." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don’t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Ben Franklin
item.description: "Instead of cursing the darkness, light a candle." -- Ben Franklin

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "The Constitution only guarantees the American people the right to pursue happiness. You have to catch it yourself." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by James Russell Lowell
item.description: "There is no good arguing with the inevitable. The only argument available with an east wind is to put on your overcoat." -- James Russell Lowell

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by James Russell Lowell
item.description: "The mind can weave itself warmly in the cocoon of its own thoughts, and dwell a hermit anywhere." -- James Russell Lowell

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Some changes look negative on the surface but you will soon realize that space is being created in your life for something new to emerge." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "You do not become good by trying to be good, but by finding the goodness that is already within you, and allowing that goodness to emerge. But it can only emerge if something fundamental changes in your state of consciousness." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Man made God in his own image..." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "To love is to recognize yourself in another." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "What you react to in others, you strengthen in yourself." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Living up to an image that you have of yourself or that other people have of you is inauthentic living." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "If you get the inside right, the outside will fall into place. Primary reality is within; secondary reality without." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Being spiritual has nothing to do with what you believe and everything to do with your state of consciousness." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "When another recognizes you, that recognition draws the dimension of Being more fully into this world through both of you. That is the love that redeems the world." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "The greater part of human pain is unnecessary. It is self-created as long as the unobserved mind runs your life." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Give up defining yourself - to yourself or to others. You won't die. You will come to life. And don't be concerned with how others define you. When they define you, they are limiting themselves, so it's their problem. Whenever you interact with people, don't be there primarily as a function or a role, but as the field of conscious Presence. You can only lose something that you have, but you cannot lose something that you are." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Whatever the present moment contains, accept it as if you had chosen it." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation but your thoughts about it." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "One man's theology is another man's belly laugh." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Mary E. add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Being right too soon is socially unacceptable." -- Robert A. Heinlein
